2777   /**
2778    * Atomically bulk load several HFiles into an open region
2779    * @return true if successful, false is failed but recoverably (no action)
2780    * @throws IOException if failed unrecoverably
2781    */
2782   @Override
2783   public boolean bulkLoadHFiles(List<Pair<byte[], String>> familyPaths,
2784       byte[] regionName) throws IOException {
2785     checkOpen();
2786     HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
2787     boolean bypass = false;
2788     if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
2789       bypass = region.getCoprocessorHost().preBulkLoadHFile(familyPaths);
2790     }
2791     boolean loaded = false;
2792     if (!bypass) {
2793       loaded = region.bulkLoadHFiles(familyPaths);
2794     }
2795     if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
2796       loaded = region.getCoprocessorHost().postBulkLoadHFile(familyPaths, loaded);
2797     }
2798     return loaded;
2799   }

2834   @Override
2835   @QosPriority(priority = HConstants.HIGH_QOS)
2836   public RegionOpeningState openRegion(HRegionInfo region, int versionOfOfflineNode)
2837       throws IOException {
2838     return openRegion(region, versionOfOfflineNode, null);
2839   }
2840 
2841   private RegionOpeningState openRegion(HRegionInfo region, int versionOfOfflineNode,
2842       Map<String, HTableDescriptor> htds) throws IOException {
2843     checkOpen();
2844     HRegion onlineRegion = this.getFromOnlineRegions(region.getEncodedName());
2845     if (null != onlineRegion) {
2846       // See HBASE-5094. Cross check with META if still this RS is owning the
2847       // region.
2848       Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> p = MetaReader.getRegion(
2849           this.catalogTracker, region.getRegionName());
2850       if (this.getServerName().equals(p.getSecond())) {
2851         LOG.warn("Attempted open of " + region.getEncodedName()
2852             + " but already online on this server");
2853         return RegionOpeningState.ALREADY_OPENED;
2854       } else {
2855         LOG.warn("The region " + region.getEncodedName()
2856             + " is online on this server but META does not have this server.");
2857         this.removeFromOnlineRegions(region.getEncodedName());
2858       }
2859     }
2860     // Added to in-memory RS RIT that we are trying to open this region.
2861     // Clear it if we fail queuing an open executor.
2862     addRegionsInTransition(region, OPEN);
2863     try {
2864       LOG.info("Received request to open region: " +
2865         region.getRegionNameAsString());
2866       HTableDescriptor htd = null;
2867       if (htds == null) {
2868         htd = this.tableDescriptors.get(region.getTableName());
2869       } else {
2870         htd = htds.get(region.getTableNameAsString());
2871         if (htd == null) {
2872           htd = this.tableDescriptors.get(region.getTableName());
2873           htds.put(region.getTableNameAsString(), htd);
2874         }
2875       }
2876 
2877       // Mark the region as OPENING up in zk.  This is how we tell the master control of the
2878       // region has passed to this regionserver.
2879       int version = transitionZookeeperOfflineToOpening(region, versionOfOfflineNode);
2880       // Need to pass the expected version in the constructor.
2881       if (region.isRootRegion()) {
2882         this.service.submit(new OpenRootHandler(this, this, region, htd, version));
2883       } else if (region.isMetaRegion()) {
2884         this.service.submit(new OpenMetaHandler(this, this, region, htd, version));
2885       } else {
2886         this.service.submit(new OpenRegionHandler(this, this, region, htd, version));
2887       }
2888     } catch (IOException ie) {
2889       // Clear from this server's RIT list else will stick around for ever.
2890       removeFromRegionsInTransition(region);
2891       throw ie;
2892     }
2893     return RegionOpeningState.OPENED;
2894   }

2896   /**
2897    * Transition ZK node from OFFLINE to OPENING. The master will get a callback
2898    * and will know that the region is now ours.
2899    *
2900    * @param hri
2901    *          HRegionInfo whose znode we are updating
2902    * @param versionOfOfflineNode
2903    *          Version Of OfflineNode that needs to be compared before changing
2904    *          the node's state from OFFLINE
2905    * @throws IOException
2906    */
2907   int transitionZookeeperOfflineToOpening(final HRegionInfo hri, int versionOfOfflineNode)
2908       throws IOException {
2909     // TODO: should also handle transition from CLOSED?
2910     int version = -1;
2911     try {
2912       // Initialize the znode version.
2913       version = ZKAssign.transitionNode(this.zooKeeper, hri, this.getServerName(),
2914           EventType.M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE, EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENING, versionOfOfflineNode);
2915     } catch (KeeperException e) {
2916       LOG.error("Error transition from OFFLINE to OPENING for region=" + hri.getEncodedName(), e);
2917     }
2918     if (version == -1) {
2919       // TODO: Fix this sloppyness. The exception should be coming off zk
2920       // directly, not an
2921       // intepretation at this high-level (-1 when we call transitionNode can
2922       // mean many things).
2923       throw new IOException("Failed transition from OFFLINE to OPENING for region="
2924           + hri.getEncodedName());
2925     }
2926     return version;
2927   }

2929    /**
2930     * String currentAction) throws RegionAlreadyInTransitionException { Add
2931     * region to this regionservers list of in transitions regions ONLY if its not
2932     * already byte[] encodedName = region.getEncodedNameAsBytes(); in transition.
2933     * If a region already in RIT, we throw
2934     * {@link RegionAlreadyInTransitionException}. if
2935     * (this.regionsInTransitionInRS.containsKey(encodedName)) { Callers need to
2936     * call {@link #removeFromRegionsInTransition(HRegionInfo)} when done or if
2937     * boolean openAction = this.regionsInTransitionInRS.get(encodedName); error
2938     * processing.
2939     *
2940     * @param region
2941     *          Region to add
2942     * @param currentAction
2943     *          Whether OPEN or CLOSE.
2944     * @throws RegionAlreadyInTransitionException
2945     */
2946    protected void addRegionsInTransition(final HRegionInfo region, final String currentAction)
2947        throws RegionAlreadyInTransitionException {
2948      Boolean action = this.regionsInTransitionInRS.putIfAbsent(region.getEncodedNameAsBytes(),
2949          currentAction.equals(OPEN));
2950      if (action != null) {
2951        // The below exception message will be used in master.
2952        throw new RegionAlreadyInTransitionException("Received:" + currentAction + " for the region:"
2953            + region.getRegionNameAsString() + " for the region:" + region.getRegionNameAsString()
2954            + ", which we are already trying to " + (action ? OPEN : CLOSE) + ".");
2955      }
2956    }

2990   @QosPriority(priority=HConstants.HIGH_QOS)
2991   protected boolean closeRegion(HRegionInfo region, final boolean zk,
2992     final int versionOfClosingNode)
2993   throws IOException {
2994     checkOpen();
2995     //Check for permissions to close.
2996     HRegion actualRegion = this.getFromOnlineRegions(region.getEncodedName());
2997     if (actualRegion != null && actualRegion.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
2998       actualRegion.getCoprocessorHost().preClose(false);
2999     }
3000     LOG.info("Received close region: " + region.getRegionNameAsString() +
3001       ". Version of ZK closing node:" + versionOfClosingNode);
3002     boolean hasit = this.onlineRegions.containsKey(region.getEncodedName());
3003     if (!hasit) {
3004       LOG.warn("Received close for region we are not serving; " +
3005         region.getEncodedName());
3006       throw new NotServingRegionException("Received close for "
3007         + region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but we are not serving it");
3008     }
3009     return closeRegion(region, false, zk, versionOfClosingNode);
3010   }

3019   /**
3020    * @param region Region to close
3021    * @param abort True if we are aborting
3022    * @param zk True if we are to update zk about the region close; if the close
3023    * was orchestrated by master, then update zk.  If the close is being run by
3024    * the regionserver because its going down, don't update zk.
3025    * @return True if closed a region.
3026    */
3027   protected boolean closeRegion(HRegionInfo region, final boolean abort,
3028       final boolean zk) {
3029     return closeRegion(region, abort, zk, -1);
3030   }

3032 
3033   /**
3034    * @param region Region to close
3035    * @param abort True if we are aborting
3036    * @param zk True if we are to update zk about the region close; if the close
3037    * was orchestrated by master, then update zk.  If the close is being run by
3038    * the regionserver because its going down, don't update zk.
3039    * @param versionOfClosingNode
3040    *   the version of znode to compare when RS transitions the znode from
3041    *   CLOSING state.
3042    * @return True if closed a region.
3043    */
3044   protected boolean closeRegion(HRegionInfo region, final boolean abort,
3045       final boolean zk, final int versionOfClosingNode) {
3046     
3047     HRegion actualRegion = this.getFromOnlineRegions(region.getEncodedName());
3048     if (actualRegion != null && actualRegion.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3049       try {
3050         actualRegion.getCoprocessorHost().preClose(abort);
3051       } catch (IOException e) {
3052         LOG.warn(e);
3053         return false;
3054       }
3055     }
3056     try {
3057       addRegionsInTransition(region, CLOSE);
3058     } catch (RegionAlreadyInTransitionException rate) {
3059       LOG.warn("Received close for region we are already opening or closing; "
3060           + region.getEncodedName());
3061       return false;
3062     }
3063     boolean success = false;
3064     try {
3065       CloseRegionHandler crh = null;
3066       if (region.isRootRegion()) {
3067         crh = new CloseRootHandler(this, this, region, abort, zk, versionOfClosingNode);
3068       } else if (region.isMetaRegion()) {
3069         crh = new CloseMetaHandler(this, this, region, abort, zk, versionOfClosingNode);
3070       } else {
3071         crh = new CloseRegionHandler(this, this, region, abort, zk, versionOfClosingNode);
3072       }
3073       this.service.submit(crh);
3074       success = true;
3075     } finally {
3076       // Remove from this server's RIT.
3077       if (!success) removeFromRegionsInTransition(region);
3078     }
3079     return true;
3080   }

3082   /**
3083    * @param encodedRegionName
3084    *          encodedregionName to close
3085    * @param abort
3086    *          True if we are aborting
3087    * @param zk
3088    *          True if we are to update zk about the region close; if the close
3089    *          was orchestrated by master, then update zk. If the close is being
3090    *          run by the regionserver because its going down, don't update zk.
3091    * @return True if closed a region.
3092    */
3093   protected boolean closeRegion(byte[] encodedRegionName, final boolean abort,
3094       final boolean zk) throws IOException {
3095     String encodedRegionNameStr = Bytes.toString(encodedRegionName);
3096     HRegion region = this.getFromOnlineRegions(encodedRegionNameStr);
3097     if (null != region) {
3098       return closeRegion(region.getRegionInfo(), abort, zk);
3099     }
3100     LOG.error("The specified region name" + encodedRegionNameStr
3101         + " does not exist to close the region.");
3102     return false;
3103   }

3107   @Override

3141   @Override
3142   @QosPriority(priority=HConstants.HIGH_QOS)
3143   public void compactRegion(HRegionInfo regionInfo, boolean major,  byte[] family)
3144       throws NotServingRegionException, IOException {
3145     checkOpen();
3146     HRegion region = getRegion(regionInfo.getRegionName());
3147     Store store = null;
3148     if (family != null) {
3149       store = region.getStore(family);
3150       if (store == null) {
3151         throw new IOException("column family " + Bytes.toString(family) +
3152           " does not exist in region " + new String(region.getRegionNameAsString()));
3153       }
3154     }
3155 
3156     if (major) {
3157       if (family != null) {
3158         store.triggerMajorCompaction();
3159       } else {
3160         region.triggerMajorCompaction();
3161       }
3162     }
3163     String familyLogMsg = (family != null)?" for column family: " + Bytes.toString(family):"";
3164     LOG.trace("User-triggered compaction requested for region " +
3165       region.getRegionNameAsString() + familyLogMsg);
3166     String log = "User-triggered " + (major ? "major " : "") + "compaction" + familyLogMsg;
3167     if (family != null) {
3168       compactSplitThread.requestCompaction(region, store, log,
3169         Store.PRIORITY_USER, null);
3170     } else {
3171       compactSplitThread.requestCompaction(region, log,
3172         Store.PRIORITY_USER, null);
3173     }
3174   }

3226   /**
3227    * @param encodedRegionName
3228    * @return JSON Map of labels to values for passed in <code>encodedRegionName</code>
3229    * @throws IOException
3230    */
3231   public byte [] getRegionStats(final String encodedRegionName)
3232   throws IOException {
3233     HRegion r = null;
3234     synchronized (this.onlineRegions) {
3235       r = this.onlineRegions.get(encodedRegionName);
3236     }
3237     if (r == null) return null;
3238     ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper();
3239     int stores = 0;
3240     int storefiles = 0;
3241     int storefileSizeMB = 0;
3242     int memstoreSizeMB = (int) (r.memstoreSize.get() / 1024 / 1024);
3243     int storefileIndexSizeMB = 0;
3244     long totalCompactingKVs = 0;
3245     long currentCompactedKVs = 0;
3246     synchronized (r.stores) {
3247       stores += r.stores.size();
3248       for (Store store : r.stores.values()) {
3249         storefiles += store.getStorefilesCount();
3250         storefileSizeMB += (int) (store.getStorefilesSize() / 1024 / 1024);
3251         storefileIndexSizeMB += (int) (store.getStorefilesIndexSize() / 1024 / 1024);
3252       }
3253     }
3254     Map<String, Integer> map = new TreeMap<String, Integer>();
3255     map.put("stores", stores);
3256     map.put("storefiles", storefiles);
3257     map.put("storefileSizeMB", storefileIndexSizeMB);
3258     map.put("memstoreSizeMB", memstoreSizeMB);
3259     StringWriter w = new StringWriter();
3260     mapper.writeValue(w, map);
3261     w.close();
3262     return Bytes.toBytes(w.toString());
3263   }

3281   @Override
3282   public boolean removeFromOnlineRegions(final String encodedName) {
3283     HRegion toReturn = null;
3284     toReturn = this.onlineRegions.remove(encodedName);
3285     
3286     //Clear all of the dynamic metrics as they are now probably useless.
3287     //This is a clear because dynamic metrics could include metrics per cf and
3288     //per hfile.  Figuring out which cfs, hfiles, and regions are still relevant to
3289     //this region server would be an onerous task.  Instead just clear everything
3290     //and on the next tick of the metrics everything that is still relevant will be
3291     //re-added.
3292     this.dynamicMetrics.clear();
3293     return toReturn != null;
3294   }

3296   /**
3297    * @return A new Map of online regions sorted by region size with the first
3298    *         entry being the biggest.
3299    */
3300   public SortedMap<Long, HRegion> getCopyOfOnlineRegionsSortedBySize() {
3301     // we'll sort the regions in reverse
3302     SortedMap<Long, HRegion> sortedRegions = new TreeMap<Long, HRegion>(
3303         new Comparator<Long>() {
3304           public int compare(Long a, Long b) {
3305             return -1 * a.compareTo(b);
3306           }
3307         });
3308     // Copy over all regions. Regions are sorted by size with biggest first.
3309     for (HRegion region : this.onlineRegions.values()) {
3310       sortedRegions.put(Long.valueOf(region.memstoreSize.get()), region);
3311     }
3312     return sortedRegions;
3313   }

3367   /**
3368    * Get the top N most loaded regions this server is serving so we can tell the
3369    * master which regions it can reallocate if we're overloaded. TODO: actually
3370    * calculate which regions are most loaded. (Right now, we're just grabbing
3371    * the first N regions being served regardless of load.)
3372    */
3373   protected HRegionInfo[] getMostLoadedRegions() {
3374     ArrayList<HRegionInfo> regions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
3375     for (HRegion r : onlineRegions.values()) {
3376       if (!r.isAvailable()) {
3377         continue;
3378       }
3379       if (regions.size() < numRegionsToReport) {
3380         regions.add(r.getRegionInfo());
3381       } else {
3382         break;
3383       }
3384     }
3385     return regions.toArray(new HRegionInfo[regions.size()]);
3386   }

3456   @Override
3457   public void mutateRow(byte[] regionName, RowMutations rm)
3458       throws IOException {
3459     checkOpen();
3460     if (regionName == null) {
3461       throw new IOException("Invalid arguments to mutateRow " +
3462       "regionName is null");
3463     }
3464     requestCount.incrementAndGet();
3465     try {
3466       HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
3467       if (!region.getRegionInfo().isMetaTable()) {
3468         this.cacheFlusher.reclaimMemStoreMemory();
3469       }
3470       region.mutateRow(rm);
3471     } catch (IOException e) {
3472       checkFileSystem();
3473       throw e;
3474     }
3475   }

3477   @Override
3478   public Result append(byte[] regionName, Append append)
3479   throws IOException {
3480     checkOpen();
3481     if (regionName == null) {
3482       throw new IOException("Invalid arguments to increment " +
3483       "regionName is null");
3484     }
3485     requestCount.incrementAndGet();
3486     try {
3487       HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
3488       Integer lock = getLockFromId(append.getLockId());
3489       Append appVal = append;
3490       Result resVal;
3491       if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3492         resVal = region.getCoprocessorHost().preAppend(appVal);
3493         if (resVal != null) {
3494           return resVal;
3495         }
3496       }
3497       resVal = region.append(appVal, lock, append.getWriteToWAL());
3498       if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3499         region.getCoprocessorHost().postAppend(appVal, resVal);
3500       }
3501       return resVal;
3502     } catch (IOException e) {
3503       checkFileSystem();
3504       throw e;
3505     }
3506   }

3540   /** {@inheritDoc} */
3541   public long incrementColumnValue(byte[] regionName, byte[] row,
3542       byte[] family, byte[] qualifier, long amount, boolean writeToWAL)
3543       throws IOException {
3544     checkOpen();
3545 
3546     if (regionName == null) {
3547       throw new IOException("Invalid arguments to incrementColumnValue "
3548           + "regionName is null");
3549     }
3550     requestCount.incrementAndGet();
3551     try {
3552       HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
3553       if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3554         Long amountVal = region.getCoprocessorHost().preIncrementColumnValue(row,
3555           family, qualifier, amount, writeToWAL);
3556         if (amountVal != null) {
3557           return amountVal.longValue();
3558         }
3559       }
3560       long retval = region.incrementColumnValue(row, family, qualifier, amount,
3561         writeToWAL);
3562       if (region.getCoprocessorHost() != null) {
3563         retval = region.getCoprocessorHost().postIncrementColumnValue(row,
3564           family, qualifier, amount, writeToWAL, retval);
3565       }
3566       return retval;
3567     } catch (IOException e) {
3568       checkFileSystem();
3569       throw e;
3570     }

3584   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
3585   @Override
3586   public <R> MultiResponse multi(MultiAction<R> multi) throws IOException {
3587     checkOpen();
3588     MultiResponse response = new MultiResponse();
3589     for (Map.Entry<byte[], List<Action<R>>> e : multi.actions.entrySet()) {
3590       byte[] regionName = e.getKey();
3591       List<Action<R>> actionsForRegion = e.getValue();
3592       // sort based on the row id - this helps in the case where we reach the
3593       // end of a region, so that we don't have to try the rest of the
3594       // actions in the list.
3595       Collections.sort(actionsForRegion);
3596       Row action;
3597       List<Action<R>> mutations = new ArrayList<Action<R>>();
3598       for (Action<R> a : actionsForRegion) {
3599         action = a.getAction();
3600         int originalIndex = a.getOriginalIndex();
3601 
3602         try {
3603           if (action instanceof Delete || action instanceof Put) {
3604             mutations.add(a); 
3605           } else if (action instanceof Get) {
3606             response.add(regionName, originalIndex,
3607                 get(regionName, (Get)action));
3608           } else if (action instanceof Exec) {
3609             ExecResult result = execCoprocessor(regionName, (Exec)action);
3610             response.add(regionName, new Pair<Integer, Object>(
3611                 a.getOriginalIndex(), result.getValue()
3612             ));
3613           } else if (action instanceof Increment) {
3614             response.add(regionName, originalIndex,
3615                 increment(regionName, (Increment)action));
3616           } else if (action instanceof Append) {
3617             response.add(regionName, originalIndex,
3618                 append(regionName, (Append)action));
3619           } else if (action instanceof RowMutations) {
3620             mutateRow(regionName, (RowMutations)action);
3621             response.add(regionName, originalIndex, new Result());
3622           } else {
3623             LOG.debug("Error: invalid Action, row must be a Get, Delete, " +
3624                 "Put, Exec, Increment, or Append.");
3625             throw new DoNotRetryIOException("Invalid Action, row must be a " +
3626                 "Get, Delete, Put, Exec, Increment, or Append.");
3627           }
3628         } catch (IOException ex) {
3629           response.add(regionName, originalIndex, ex);
3630         }
3631       }
3632 
3633       // We do the puts with result.put so we can get the batching efficiency
3634       // we so need. All this data munging doesn't seem great, but at least
3635       // we arent copying bytes or anything.
3636       if (!mutations.isEmpty()) {
3637         try {
3638           HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
3639 
3640           if (!region.getRegionInfo().isMetaTable()) {
3641             this.cacheFlusher.reclaimMemStoreMemory();
3642           }
3643 
3644           List<Pair<Mutation,Integer>> mutationsWithLocks =
3645               Lists.newArrayListWithCapacity(mutations.size());
3646           for (Action<R> a : mutations) {
3647             Mutation m = (Mutation) a.getAction();
3648 
3649             Integer lock;
3650             try {
3651               lock = getLockFromId(m.getLockId());
3652             } catch (UnknownRowLockException ex) {
3653               response.add(regionName, a.getOriginalIndex(), ex);
3654               continue;
3655             }
3656             mutationsWithLocks.add(new Pair<Mutation, Integer>(m, lock));
3657           }
3658 
3659           this.requestCount.addAndGet(mutations.size());
3660 
3661           OperationStatus[] codes =
3662               region.batchMutate(mutationsWithLocks.toArray(new Pair[]{}));
3663 
3664           for( int i = 0 ; i < codes.length ; i++) {
3665             OperationStatus code = codes[i];
3666 
3667             Action<R> theAction = mutations.get(i);
3668             Object result = null;
3669 
3670             if (code.getOperationStatusCode() == OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS) {
3671               result = new Result();
3672             } else if (code.getOperationStatusCode()
3673                 == OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE) {
3674               // Don't send a FailedSanityCheckException as older clients will not know about
3675               // that class being a subclass of DoNotRetryIOException
3676               // and will retry mutations that will never succeed.
3677               result = new DoNotRetryIOException(code.getExceptionMsg());
3678             } else if (code.getOperationStatusCode() == OperationStatusCode.BAD_FAMILY) {
3679               result = new NoSuchColumnFamilyException(code.getExceptionMsg());
3680             }
3681             // FAILURE && NOT_RUN becomes null, aka: need to run again.
3682 
3683             response.add(regionName, theAction.getOriginalIndex(), result);
3684           }
3685         } catch (IOException ioe) {
3686           // fail all the puts with the ioe in question.
3687           for (Action<R> a: mutations) {
3688             response.add(regionName, a.getOriginalIndex(), ioe);
3689           }
3690         }
3691       }
3692     }
3693     return response;
3694   }

3696   /**
3697    * Executes a single {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol}
3698    * method using the registered protocol handlers.
3699    * {@link CoprocessorProtocol} implementations must be registered per-region
3700    * via the
3701    * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion#registerProtocol(Class, org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol)}
3702    * method before they are available.
3703    *
3704    * @param regionName name of the region against which the invocation is executed
3705    * @param call an {@code Exec} instance identifying the protocol, method name,
3706    *     and parameters for the method invocation
3707    * @return an {@code ExecResult} instance containing the region name of the
3708    *     invocation and the return value
3709    * @throws IOException if no registered protocol handler is found or an error
3710    *     occurs during the invocation
3711    * @see org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegion#registerProtocol(Class, org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.CoprocessorProtocol)
3712    */
3713   @Override
3714   public ExecResult execCoprocessor(byte[] regionName, Exec call)
3715       throws IOException {
3716     checkOpen();
3717     requestCount.incrementAndGet();
3718     try {
3719       HRegion region = getRegion(regionName);
3720       return region.exec(call);
3721     } catch (Throwable t) {
3722       throw convertThrowableToIOE(cleanup(t));
3723     }
3724   }

3783   /**
3784    * Load the replication service objects, if any
3785    */
3786   static private void createNewReplicationInstance(Configuration conf,
3787     HRegionServer server, FileSystem fs, Path logDir, Path oldLogDir) throws IOException{
3788 
3789     // If replication is not enabled, then return immediately.
3790     if (!conf.getBoolean(HConstants.REPLICATION_ENABLE_KEY, false)) {
3791       return;
3792     }
3793 
3794     // read in the name of the source replication class from the config file.
3795     String sourceClassname = conf.get(HConstants.REPLICATION_SOURCE_SERVICE_CLASSNAME,
3796                                HConstants.REPLICATION_SERVICE_CLASSNAME_DEFAULT);
3797 
3798     // read in the name of the sink replication class from the config file.
3799     String sinkClassname = conf.get(HConstants.REPLICATION_SINK_SERVICE_CLASSNAME,
3800                              HConstants.REPLICATION_SERVICE_CLASSNAME_DEFAULT);
3801 
3802     // If both the sink and the source class names are the same, then instantiate
3803     // only one object.
3804     if (sourceClassname.equals(sinkClassname)) {
3805       server.replicationSourceHandler = (ReplicationSourceService)
3806                                          newReplicationInstance(sourceClassname,
3807                                          conf, server, fs, logDir, oldLogDir);
3808       server.replicationSinkHandler = (ReplicationSinkService)
3809                                          server.replicationSourceHandler;
3810     }
3811     else {
3812       server.replicationSourceHandler = (ReplicationSourceService)
3813                                          newReplicationInstance(sourceClassname,
3814                                          conf, server, fs, logDir, oldLogDir);
3815       server.replicationSinkHandler = (ReplicationSinkService)
3816                                          newReplicationInstance(sinkClassname,
3817                                          conf, server, fs, logDir, oldLogDir);
3818     }
3819   }

3821   static private ReplicationService newReplicationInstance(String classname,
3822     Configuration conf, HRegionServer server, FileSystem fs, Path logDir,
3823     Path oldLogDir) throws IOException{
3824 
3825     Class<?> clazz = null;
3826     try {
3827       ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
3828       clazz = Class.forName(classname, true, classLoader);
3829     } catch (java.lang.ClassNotFoundException nfe) {
3830       throw new IOException("Cound not find class for " + classname);
3831     }
3832 
3833     // create an instance of the replication object.
3834     ReplicationService service = (ReplicationService)
3835                               ReflectionUtils.newInstance(clazz, conf);
3836     service.initialize(server, fs, logDir, oldLogDir);
3837     return service;
3838   }

3852    * @param name
3853    * @return Thread the RegionServer is running in correctly named.
3854    * @throws IOException
3855    */
3856   public static Thread startRegionServer(final HRegionServer hrs,
3857       final String name) throws IOException {
3858     Thread t = new Thread(hrs);
3859     t.setName(name);
3860     t.start();
3861     // Install shutdown hook that will catch signals and run an orderly shutdown
3862     // of the hrs.
3863     ShutdownHook.install(hrs.getConfiguration(), FileSystem.get(hrs
3864         .getConfiguration()), hrs, t);
3865     return t;

3922   /**
3923    * Gets the online regions of the specified table.
3924    * This method looks at the in-memory onlineRegions.  It does not go to <code>.META.</code>.
3925    * Only returns <em>online</em> regions.  If a region on this table has been
3926    * closed during a disable, etc., it will not be included in the returned list.
3927    * So, the returned list may not necessarily be ALL regions in this table, its
3928    * all the ONLINE regions in the table.
3929    * @param tableName
3930    * @return Online regions from <code>tableName</code>
3931    */
3932    public List<HRegion> getOnlineRegions(byte[] tableName) {
3933      List<HRegion> tableRegions = new ArrayList<HRegion>();
3934      synchronized (this.onlineRegions) {
3935        for (HRegion region: this.onlineRegions.values()) {
3936          HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getRegionInfo();
3937          if(Bytes.equals(regionInfo.getTableName(), tableName)) {
3938            tableRegions.add(region);
3939          }
3940        }
3941      }
3942      return tableRegions;
3943    }
